DOC.brief_summary: Falls and injurious falls are common among elderly people. The aim of the study is to test a model of multifactorial fall intervention in a Danish population of elderly sustaining a fall. Focus is on prevention of further falls, patients views on fall prevention and a cost-effectiveness analysis.
DOC.brief_title: Examination and Treatment of Elderly After a Fall
DOC.criteria: 65 years old or older Having been treated in emergency department or submitted to hospital after a fall Living in the Glostrup area. Fall due to strong external force, new apoplexia cerebri, epileptic seizure, alcohol intoxication. Known cognitive impairment Not able to walk prior to fall Living in institution Planned geriatric intervention.
